answers.answer: Yellowing nails are early signals of various internal disorders, such as diabetes, respiratory or liver problems.It could also be from eating too much fatty foods.Or it could be from nail polishes too. Sometimes too much removing and putting on nail polish without a proper base can result in yellowing nails.I hope this helped..:D

question: lately i've been noticing that as i'm removing nail polish, filing and repainting my nails, the bottom half of them are turning a yellowish color. they don't hurt or feel any different and nothing in my diet has changed. i read online that it could be a symptom of number of diseases or malnutrition, but i'm pretty sure i don't fit into any of those categories, and i don't smoke so i can't blame it on that. any ideas on how to turn them basck to their normal color?thanks in advance.
title: bottom half of the nails turning yellow
